verses.kjv: Then I looked, and, behold, in the firmament that was above the head of the cherubims there appeared over them as it were a sapphire stone, as the appearance of the likeness of a throne.
verses.ct: Then I looked, and there in the expanse above the heads of the cherubim, something like a sapphire stone appeared — what looked like the shape of a throne.

verses.kjv: And he spake unto the man clothed with linen, and said, Go in between the wheels, even under the cherub, and fill thine hand with coals of fire from between the cherubims, and scatter them over the city. And he went in in my sight.
verses.ct: He spoke to the man dressed in linen and said, 'Go in among the wheels beneath the cherubim, fill your hands with burning coals from between the cherubim, and scatter them over the city.' The man went in as I watched.

verses.kjv: Now the cherubims stood on the right side of the house, when the man went in; and the cloud filled the inner court.
verses.ct: The cherubim were standing on the south side of the temple when the man entered, and the cloud filled the inner courtyard.

verses.kjv: Then the glory of the LORD went up from the cherub, and stood over the threshold of the house; and the house was filled with the cloud, and the court was full of the brightness of the LORD’s glory.
verses.ct: Then the glory of the LORD rose up from above the cherubim and moved to the doorway of the temple. The temple was filled with the cloud, and the courtyard was radiant with the brightness of the LORD's glory.

verses.kjv: And the sound of the cherubims’ wings was heard even to the outer court, as the voice of the Almighty God when he speaketh.
verses.ct: The noise of the cherubim's wings could be heard all the way to the outer courtyard — it was like the voice of the Almighty God when he speaks.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, that when he had commanded the man clothed with linen, saying, Take fire from between the wheels, from between the cherubims; then he went in, and stood beside the wheels.
verses.ct: When he commanded the man dressed in linen, 'Take fire from among the wheels, from between the cherubim,' the man went in and stood next to one of the wheels.

verses.kjv: And one cherub stretched forth his hand from between the cherubims unto the fire that was between the cherubims, and took thereof, and put it into the hands of him that was clothed with linen: who took it, and went out.
verses.ct: One of the cherubim reached out his hand toward the fire that was between the cherubim, scooped some up, and placed it into the hands of the man dressed in linen. The man took it and went out.

verses.kjv: And there appeared in the cherubims the form of a man’s hand under their wings.
verses.ct: Under the wings of the cherubim, something shaped like a human hand could be seen.

verses.kjv: And when I looked, behold the four wheels by the cherubims, one wheel by one cherub, and another wheel by another cherub: and the appearance of the wheels was as the colour of a beryl stone.
verses.ct: When I looked, I saw 4 wheels beside the cherubim — one wheel next to each cherub. The wheels gleamed like the color of beryl stone.

verses.kjv: And as for their appearances, they four had one likeness, as if a wheel had been in the midst of a wheel.
verses.ct: All 4 of them looked identical, as though one wheel were intersecting another wheel at its center.

verses.kjv: When they went, they went upon their four sides; they turned not as they went, but to the place whither the head looked they followed it; they turned not as they went.
verses.ct: When they moved, they could go in any of their 4 directions without turning. Whichever direction the lead one faced, the others followed — they never turned as they moved.

verses.kjv: And their whole body, and their backs, and their hands, and their wings, and the wheels, were full of eyes round about, even the wheels that they four had.
verses.ct: Their entire bodies — their backs, their hands, their wings, and the wheels — all 4 of them were covered with eyes all around.

verses.kjv: As for the wheels, it was cried unto them in my hearing, O wheel.
verses.ct: As for the wheels, I heard them called 'the whirling wheels.'

verses.kjv: And every one had four faces: the first face was the face of a cherub, and the second face was the face of a man, and the third the face of a lion, and the fourth the face of an eagle.
verses.ct: Each one had 4 faces: the first was the face of a cherub, the second was a human face, the third was a lion's face, and the fourth was an eagle's face.

verses.kjv: And the cherubims were lifted up. This is the living creature that I saw by the river of Chebar.
verses.ct: Then the cherubim rose upward. These were the same living creatures I had seen at the Chebar River.

verses.kjv: And when the cherubims went, the wheels went by them: and when the cherubims lifted up their wings to mount up from the earth, the same wheels also turned not from beside them.
verses.ct: Whenever the cherubim moved, the wheels moved right alongside them. When the cherubim spread their wings to rise from the ground, the wheels did not leave their side.

verses.kjv: When they stood, these stood; and when they were lifted up, these lifted up themselves also: for the spirit of the living creature was in them.
verses.ct: When the cherubim stopped, the wheels stopped. When the cherubim rose, the wheels rose with them, because the spirit of the living creatures was in the wheels.

verses.kjv: Then the glory of the LORD departed from off the threshold of the house, and stood over the cherubims.
verses.ct: Then the glory of the LORD moved away from the doorway of the temple and positioned itself above the cherubim.

verses.kjv: And the cherubims lifted up their wings, and mounted up from the earth in my sight: when they went out, the wheels also were beside them, and every one stood at the door of the east gate of the LORD’s house; and the glory of the God of Israel was over them above.
verses.ct: The cherubim spread their wings and rose from the ground right before my eyes. As they moved out, the wheels went alongside them. They stopped at the entrance of the east gate of the LORD's temple, and the glory of the God of Israel hovered above them.

verses.kjv: This is the living creature that I saw under the God of Israel by the river of Chebar; and I knew that they were the cherubims.
verses.ct: These were the same living creatures I had seen beneath the God of Israel at the Chebar River, and I realized they were the cherubim.

verses.kjv: Every one had four faces apiece, and every one four wings; and the likeness of the hands of a man was under their wings.
verses.ct: Each one had 4 faces and 4 wings, and under their wings was what looked like human hands.

verses.kjv: And the likeness of their faces was the same faces which I saw by the river of Chebar, their appearances and themselves: they went every one straight forward.
verses.ct: Their faces looked exactly like the ones I had seen at the Chebar River — the same appearance, the same beings. Each one moved straight in whatever direction it faced.
